test/graphics/robot_joystick.cpp

00001 #include<Myro.h>
00002 #include<iostream>
00003 
00004 using namespace std;
00005 
00006 Pixel red = {255,0,0};
00007 Pixel green = {0,255,0};
00008 Pixel blue = {0,0,255};
00009 Pixel white = {255,255,255};
00010 Pixel black = {0,0,0};
00011 
00012 int main(){
00013 
00014     connect();
00015     robot.setForwardness("fluke-forward");
00016     //VideoStream vs(robot, VideoStream::COLOR);
00017     GraphWin win("Joystick", 500, 500);
00018     //vs.startStream();
00019 
00020     Circle cir(Point(250,250), 250);
00021     cir.setWidth(3);
00022     cir.draw(win);
00023 
00024     // Constantly poll the mouse position and draw a circle
00025     Point dir;
00026     Point m;
00027     Point center(250,250);
00028     Line l(center,center);
00029     int button=0;
00030     while(!win.isClosed()){
00031         m = win.getCurrentMouse(button);
00032         if (m.getX() >= 0 && m.getY() >= 0 && button){
00033             dir = center - m;
00034             //std::cerr << m.getX() << " " << m.getY() << std::endl;
00035             //std::cerr << dir.getX() << " " << dir.getY() << std::endl;
00036             robot.move(dir.getY()/250.0,dir.getX()/250.0);
00037             //std::cerr << "m.getX(): " << m.getX() << std::endl
00038             //          << "m.getY(): " << m.getY() << std::endl;
00039             l.undraw();
00040             l = Line(center, m);
00041             l.setWidth(3);
00042             l.draw(win);
00043         }
00044         else{
00045             l.undraw();
00046             robot.move(0,0);
00047             //std::cerr << "l.undraw(): " << std::endl;
00048         }
00049         wait(0.05);
00050     }
00051     //vs.endStream();
00052     //win.waitWinClosed();
00053     disconnect();
00054     return 0;
00055 }
